title.narrative: Justice for All - Prison Fellowship Ethiopia

description.narrative: The Embassy will provide JFA-PFE with a grant of 3 million DKK to core funding of the Program based on the Strategic Plan for 2016-2020 over a period of two years. This period encompasses the second and third year of the implementation period of the current strategic plan. The Danish contribution thus follows up on its previous support to JFA-PFE’s Strategic Plan for 2011-2015, transition to and inception phase of the organizations new strategic plan. The Program and the Strategic Plan 2016-2020 are annexed to this engagement document (Annex 1 & 2). The core funding will thus be based on the objectives set out in the Program. The Program consists of nine strategic objectives: 1. Enhanced protection of suspects’ rights in pre-trial and trial process in Ethiopia by end 2020. 2. Improved policy, legislative & institutional environment by end of 2020 3. Enhanced Status of peace in Ethiopia by end of 2020 4. Reduced prevalence of Gender Based Violence (GBV) in Ethiopia by end of 2020. 5. Reduced prevalence of Child Marriage (CM) and Female Genital Mutilation (FGM) in Amhara Region by end of 2020 6. Enhanced freedom of expression and thought in Ethiopia by end of 2020. 7. Enhanced human rights friendly (sensitive) fight of terrorism, extremism and fundamentalism by end of 2020. 8. Enhanced prisoners’ rehabilitation in Ethiopian prisons by end of 2020 9. Enhanced effectiveness of service delivery of JFA-PFE by end of 2020. In relation to the Danish development and humanitarian strategy, “The World 2030”, the Program’s objectives consequently align with Strategic Aim no. 4 and further, specifically addresses the SDGs 5, 16 and 17.
To contribute to the enhancement of status of human rights, good governance, peace and the rule of law

title.narrative:
Baseline 2015, 48.7%
Target 2019, 59 ( 65 in 2020) as per Mo Ibrahim index of African Governance
